name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: AS (Section 175) for residual bitumen for pavements
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: ARS or CRS comply with AS (Section 175) – Bitumen emulsions for the construction and maintenance of pavements
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Sign off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Austroads Specification Framework for Polymer Modified Binders and Multigrade Bitumen’s (AGPT/T190 - section 175) & table 408.161. Alternative PMB'S shall not be used without approval by Superintendent. Evidence of satisfactory field performance for 3 years required.
○ (i) HSS - S10e,S35e,10Pts CR, or alternative approved by superintendent
○ Field Produced CR - >5pts by mass of binder, Carrier oil <4Pts by volume of binder
○ (ii)SAM - S45R,S20e,18Pts CR or alternative as approved by the superintendent
○ Field Produced CR - >18pts by mass of binder, Carrier oil <4Pts by volume of binder
○ (iii)SAMI - S25e,20PtsCR or alternative as approved by the superintendent
○ Field Produced CR - >20pts by mass of binder, Carrier oil <4Pts by volume of binder
○ XSS treatments – Class S20E,S45R or S15RF or alternative as approved by the Superintendent.
○ XSS treatments are applied as a double/double application and the same binder shall be used for both applications.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cutback bitumen only. NB: bitumen emulsion alternative acceptable upon providing evidence of its characteristics.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: VicRoads Standard Specification Sections:

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Supply plant precoated aggregate from supplier or field precoated aggregate from stacksite.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All areas – within 8 hours of sealing unless otherwise agreed with the Superintendent.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: NB: Works shall not commence until the Contractor & Superintendent of works agree that the prepared surface is ready & fit for sealing. This includes a review of the material and evidence that the pavement passes compaction testing to Superintendents approval.
○ Primersealing shall not be carried out within 12 hours of forecast rain.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off, QD2190370 Sealing Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Job completed within spec requirements.
○ Job completion report, i.e. Spray Sheets to be submitted within 7 days of completion of sealing works
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off, Spray Sheets, Section 408 Attachment A
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Actual vs design rates. Variation between actual & design assessed by Table 408.121
○ ie. Variation from the Design Rates of Application for Bituminous Material < 0.1 l/m² below the design rate of application
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Acceptance - visual assessment or (where required) as per Table 408.122
○ ie. 7mm Primerseal Mean Texture Depth between 1.0mm to 2.0mm

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Acceptance -visual assessment or (where required) as per Table 408.123

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide a surface with uniform colour, texture and consistent appearance

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The contractor shall be responsible for the monitoring and maintenance of seals from the time of application until the end of the defects liability period.
○ The Contractor shall advise the Superintendent in writing of the proposed treatment to effect the above work before undertaking the work.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where the treatment for protection or repair of a seal involves the application of a further seal coat, the Contractor shall obtain the agreement of the Superintendent of the proposed treatment before undertaking the work.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed Off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All defects should be rectified six months prior to the conclusion of the Defects liability period. As stated in 408.15

○ The Contractor shall carry out at least two inspections of each job during the Defects Liability Period and provide a condition report to the Superintendent. The condition report shall detail the condition of the seal, any defects and the proposed corrective action.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Scale B Pavement Dryback and Embedment
○ 6 randomly selected test sites per lot required
○ If Mean Moisture Ratio is < 60% & Maximum of any result is < 70% then Ball Penetration not required
○ If Mean Moisture Ratio is < 65% & Maximum of any result is < 70% then Ball Penetration Maximum individual result is 3mm
○ Testing shall be undertaken no more than 24 hours before primersealing.
○ Testing schedule in accordance with 310.03 (c) and QD2190370 Sealing Checklist
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ride quality measurement shall be undertaken within 3 months of the completion of primerseal and prior to practical completion being awarded by the Superintendent.
○ The finished surface of the Primersealed pavement shall have a smooth longitudinal profile and comply with the minimum ride qaulity requirements of Scale C road as specified in Table 180.092.
– Maximum Individual Lane Roughness Value for any 100 m Subsection = 2.70 m/km/lane
– Maximum Mean Lane Roughness Value for Lot = 2.00 n/km/lane
– Maximum length of lot is 2km of continuous traffic lane
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: ITP Signed off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
